examples: A snake has a backbone, too!

examples: He's still playing his cards close to his chest.

words.defineEn: the front part of the body between the neck and the stomach

examples: The earliest known false teeth, or dentures, date from the 15th century, when rich people were willing to spend a large sum of money for uncomfortable false teeth carved from ivory, animal teeth, or wood.

The earliest known false teeth, or dentures, date from the 15th century, when rich people were willing to spend a large sum of money for uncomfortable false teeth carved from ivory, animal teeth, or wood.
It's true, I have a weakness for it, 'cause as a kid, my grandmother was bedridden and I used to help her, spend time with her, brush her false teeth and take her bed pan out.
words.defineEn: special fake teeth that can be taken out of someone's mouth and used to replace teeth that are missing
words.defineVi: răng giả đặc biệt có thể được lấy ra khỏi miệng của ai đó và được sử dụng để thay thế răng bị mất

examples: I noticed the cow's strong muscles as it moved around.

examples: She prefers boneless turkey breast for its ease of slicing.

words.defineEn: the area between the neck and the stomach

examples: The town has become very down at heel.

words.defineEn: the back part of the foot, below the ankle
words.defineVi: phần sau của bàn chân, dưới mắt cá chân

words.defineEn: a place in the body where two bones meet, enabling one of them to bend or move around

examples: The heart is a vital organ that pumps blood throughout the body.

words.defineVi: cấu trúc xương hỗ trợ cơ thể của một con vật hoặc một người

examples: We thought a week in a secluded cabin with no TV or Internet would make for some great family bonding, but we were all bored out of our skulls after a couple of days.

it's on my wrist right now.
